org.flixel
Class FlxTilemap

java.lang.Object
  org.flixel.FlxPoint
      org.flixel.FlxRect
          org.flixel.FlxObject
              org.flixel.FlxTilemap

public class FlxTilemap
extends FlxObject

This is a traditional tilemap display and collision class. It takes a string of comma-separated numbers and then associates those values with tiles from the sheet you pass in. It also includes some handy static parsers that can convert arrays or PNG files into strings that can be successfully loaded.

Method Detail

loadMap

public FlxTilemap loadMap(java.lang.String MapData,
                          java.lang.Integer TileGraphic,
                          int TileWidth,
                          int TileHeight)
Load the tilemap with string data and a tile graphic.

Parameters:
MapData - A string of comma and line-return delineated indices indicating what order the tiles should go in.
TileGraphic - All the tiles you want to use, arranged in a strip corresponding to the numbers in MapData.
TileWidth - The width of your tiles (e.g. 8) - defaults to height of the tile graphic if unspecified.
TileHeight - The height of your tiles (e.g. 8) - defaults to width if unspecified.
Returns:
A pointer this instance of FlxTilemap, for chaining as usual :)

                          java.lang.Integer TileGraphic,
                          int TileWidth)

preCollide

public void preCollide(FlxObject Object)
FlxU.collide() (and thus FlxObject.collide()) call this function each time two objects are compared to see if they collide. It doesn't necessarily mean these objects WILL collide, however.

Overrides:
preCollide in class FlxObject
Parameters:
Object - The FlxObject you're about to run into.

getTile

public int getTile(int X,
                   int Y)
Check the value of a particular tile.

Parameters:
X - The X coordinate of the tile (in tiles, not pixels).
Y - The Y coordinate of the tile (in tiles, not pixels).
Returns:
A uint containing the value of the tile at this spot in the array.

getTileByIndex

public int getTileByIndex(int Index)
Get the value of a tile in the tilemap by index.

Parameters:
Index - The slot in the data array (Y * widthInTiles + X) where this tile is stored.
Returns:
A uint containing the value of the tile at this spot in the array.

setTile

public boolean setTile(int X,
                       int Y,
                       int Tile,
                       boolean UpdateGraphics)
Change the data and graphic of a tile in the tilemap.

Parameters:
X - The X coordinate of the tile (in tiles, not pixels).
Y - The Y coordinate of the tile (in tiles, not pixels).
Tile - The new integer data you wish to inject.
UpdateGraphics - Whether the graphical representation of this tile should change.
Returns:
Whether or not the tile was actually changed.

follow

public void follow(int Border)
Call this function to lock the automatic camera to the map's edges.

Parameters:
Border - Adjusts the camera follow boundary by whatever number of tiles you specify here. Handy for blocking off deadends that are offscreen, etc. Use a negative number to add padding instead of hiding the edges.

follow

public void follow()

ray

public boolean ray(float StartX,
                   float StartY,
                   float EndX,
                   float EndY,
                   FlxPoint Result,
                   float Resolution)
Shoots a ray from the start point to the end point. If/when it passes through a tile, it stores and returns that point.

Parameters:
StartX - The X component of the ray's start.
StartY - The Y component of the ray's start.
EndX - The X component of the ray's end.
EndY - The Y component of the ray's end.
Result - A Point object containing the first wall impact.
Resolution - Defaults to 1, meaning check every tile or so. Higher means more checks!
Returns:
Whether or not there was a collision between the ray and a colliding tile.

ray

public boolean ray(float StartX,
                   float StartY,
                   float EndX,
                   float EndY,
                   FlxPoint Result)

arrayToCSV

public static java.lang.String arrayToCSV(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> Data,
                                          int Width)
Converts a one-dimensional array of tile data to a comma-separated string.

Parameters:
Data - An array full of integer tile references.
Width - The number of tiles in each row.
Returns:
A comma-separated string containing the level data in a FlxTilemap-friendly format.

pngToCSV

public static java.lang.String pngToCSV(int PNGFile,
                                        boolean Invert,
                                        int Scale)
Converts a PNG file to a comma-separated string. Black pixels are flagged as 'solid' by default, non-black pixels are set as non-colliding. Black pixels must be PURE BLACK.

Parameters:
PNGFile - An embedded graphic, preferably black and white.
Invert - Load white pixels as solid instead.
Returns:
A comma-separated string containing the level data in a FlxTilemap-friendly format.
